conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway/isometric 3D model with extruded walls, visible thickness, and an elevated angled viewpoint exposing interior spaces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and room volume; proper angled view; clean cutaway with mostly intact wall geometry (minor simplification at some edges/corners).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match (2 beds, living/dining, kitchen+utility, 2 toilets, 2 decks). Proportions and several partition offsets appear slightly simplified versus the 2D plan; most major wall runs align well.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, living seating, dining). Kitchen counters/appliances and bathroom fixtures are represented; a few elements are simplified blocks but remain plausibly scaled/oriented.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with clear separation of walls/floors/openings; lighting supports visibility; consistent materials and clean presentation with no obvious mesh breaks.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion simplifications: some internal partitions and room proportions appear slightly adjusted compared to the 2D plan.
Some door/window placements and opening proportions are not perfectly verifiable/matched from the render viewpoint; likely minor mismatches.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong layout fidelity overall, with only minor proportional/partition and opening-placement discrepancies from the 2D plan.
